intro: Croptilon rigidifolium, commonly known as the rigid-leaf croptilon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and features narrow, rigid leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and bloom during the late spring to early summer. Croptilon rigidifolium is often found in forest understories and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
